intro: Leptorhachis capensis, commonly known as the Cape spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Leptorhachis capensis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
